questions.question: 1. In 2D gel electrophoresis, the second-dimension separation is performed at what angle relative to the first-dimension separation? :
2. Which of the following stains used for staining proteins in 2D gel electrophoresis is incompatible with mass spectrometry?:
3. In 2D gel electrophoresis, proteins are separated based on _____ in first dimension and based on _____ in second dimension.:
4. Which of the following reagents is commonly used for solubilizing proteins in the sample preparation step of 2D gel electrophoresis?
5. Isoelectric focusing (IEF) separates proteins based on their:
6. In the equilibration step of 2D gel electrophoresis, what purpose does the SDS buffer serve?

answers.b: It coats the proteins with a negative charge.
answers.c: It removes proteins from the gel.
answers.d: It fixes the proteins in place.

questions.question: 7. One of the disadvantages of 2D gel electrophoresis is:

answers.b: Inability to separate proteins based on molecular weight

questions.question: 8. What is the primary reason for equilibrating the IEF gel or IPG strip in SDS buffer before SDS-PAGE?

answers.b: To coat the proteins with SDS and ensure uniform negative charge
answers.c: To fix the proteins in place
answers.d: To remove any remaining carrier ampholytes

questions.question: 9. What is the primary limitation of 2D gel electrophoresis compared to other proteomic techniques?

answers.a: It cannot separate proteins by isoelectric point
answers.b: It has a limited dynamic range and lower reproducibility
answers.d: It is incompatible with mass spectrometry

questions.question: 10. Which of the following best describes the second dimension of 2D gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE)?

answers.a: Separation of proteins based on their isoelectric point
answers.b: Separation of proteins based on their hydrophobicity
answers.c: Separation of proteins based on their molecular weight
answers.d: Separation of proteins based on their charge-to-mass ratio
